result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Benjamin E Wilson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
5/24/2015:
Victim/Witness Surcharge to be paid also as a Condition of ES.
AS OF 7/14/2015: Victim Witness surcharge has been PAID.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

DNA surcharge and Blood draw Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Blood costs paid to Waukesha Circuit Court and will be forwarded to Village of Chenequa Police Dept.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Not to drive unless with a valid license.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Count 3 was dismissed outright.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is serving
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Dated May 19, 2015 filed by Attorney Morin not objecting to the Court setting sentence credit at zero days on this case and requesting the victim witness surcharge be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
To Attorney Morin requesting she file a written response to the April 23, 2015 letter filed by the Department of Corrections regarding sentence credit.
State's response to the April 23, 2015 letter filed by the Department of Corrections.  The sentence credit appears to be duplicative.
To the State requesting a written response be filed with the Court by 5/15/15 in regards to 4/23/15 letter filed by the Department of Corrections.
Dated April 23, 2015 filed by the Department of Corrections requesting the Court review the sentence credit granted.
Associated with Charge #1
from ARC Fire Protection and Defendant's Parents filed by Defense
Certificate of Achievement filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Benjamin E Wilson in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed by operation of law. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years - 92 days credit,  Extended Supervision: 3 years) consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is serving. 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision
- Alcohol Assessment
- Fine totaling: $1519.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Village of Chenequa Police Department - append to fine.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety. Full-time Employment. No driving without a valid Driver's License.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Copy of Defendant's driving record filed by the State.

Defendant Benjamin E Wilson in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Defendant's driving record filed by the State. Amended Information addressed. Defense objects to the 1997 date of conviction. Court will count this as a conviction.  Defense requests another date in a week. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Amended information to be reviewed by the Court.
(Orig.) ... to file amended information. Filed by the State.

The Defendant was sent a notice on 12/11 showing the 1/6/15 court date.
Hearing on January 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
